intro: Calawaya nanegalensis, commonly known as the Philippine native tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
